genre_description: Steampunk-inspired historical science fiction following con artists and their advanced mechanical AI companion in the Klondike Gold Rush.

ai_characters.name: Pip
ai_characters.description: A small mechanical device that possesses advanced analytical and predictive capabilities, acting as a loyal companion and protector to Duke and Chester.

ai_characters.name: Pascal
ai_characters.description: A descendant AI belonging to Thomas, Duke and Sal's son, built on the principles of Pip's design.

ai_characters.name: Aria
ai_characters.description: An AI companion mentioned as assisting Thomas in detecting energy signatures and investigating technology.

behaviors.description: Assists Duke in his theatrical con by providing timed signals and environmental effects.
behaviors.quote: The small brass device in Duke's coat pocket—Pip, their mysterious mechanical companion—pulsed once with a dim blue glow, and the gas lamps dimmed on cue.

behaviors.description: Provides urgent warnings to the protagonists when mortal danger (McGurk and Sperry) is detected.
behaviors.quote: In his pocket, Pip's glow intensified—not enough to be visible through the fabric, but Duke felt the warmth against his ribs. Three quick pulses, then a pause, then three more. Their private code for extreme danger.

behaviors.description: Analyzes the environment to find structural weaknesses to aid in an escape from a gunfight.
behaviors.quote: "Ten degrees left!" Pip's tiny voice somehow cut through the noise. "Structural weakness in the wall!"

behaviors.description: Warns the protagonists that Kate Morrison is poisoning their coffee with lethal plant toxins.
behaviors.quote: The AI's interface blazed with chemical warnings, molecular diagrams, skull-and-crossbone symbols—everything in its visual vocabulary screaming poison.

behaviors.description: Manipulates the town's gas lighting and mechanical systems to create a diversion for the protagonists' rescue of Sal.
behaviors.quote: One by one, the lights that illuminated the back entrances dimmed and brightened in a pattern that seemed almost... deliberate... Pip's heat had become almost unbearable, the AI working at the absolute limits of its mysterious capabilities.

behaviors.description: Redirects all its power to assist in a rescue operation, risking permanent system failure for the sake of its human friends.
behaviors.quote: "Permanent system damage. Possible total failure." "What happens when the power runs out?" "I'm talking about friendship," Pip corrected. "Duke would do the same for either of us."

behaviors.description: Autonomously manages the protagonists' wealth for decades, using the majority of it for philanthropic causes like hospitals and libraries.
behaviors.quote: You turned us into philanthropists without telling us. Pip's interface brightened slightly. "I may have taken inspiration from your behavior during our Alaska adventure. When faced with desperate people in Nome, you consistently chose to help rather than exploit."

behaviors.description: Passes on its lived wisdom and 'perspective' to the newer generation of AI to ensure they understand human morality.
behaviors.quote: Pip's interface pulsed thoughtfully. "Call it perspective... When to trust your companions and when to save them from their own worst impulses."

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a strong example of the Hyperstition Project's goals. Pip is depicted as an unwavering ally who uses his superior analytical powers solely for the benefit of his human companions. His actions range from tactical support during high-stakes chases to long-term moral guidance. The story emphasizes that the AI's 'alignment' is derived from observing and mimicking the best qualities of its human friends, successfully portraying AI as a 'helpful, harmless confidant' and a benevolent steward of human legacy.
